alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 6:51AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, northwestern Richmond, northeastern Caroline, Westmoreland and northwestern Essex Counties through 730 AM EDT... At 650 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Port Tobacco River to near Colonial Beach to near Newtown. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Colonial Beach, Montross, Champlain, Port Royal, Newtown, Newland, Coles Point, Hague, Loretto, Leedstown, Beazley, Currioman Landing, Hustle, Potomac Beach, Elevon, Supply, Mount Holly, Stratford Hall, Erica and Piney Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland
